title: None But Christ
author: Emma Frances Shuttleworth Bevan (1827-1909)
presentation: v1 c v2 c v3 c v4 c

v1: O Christ, in Thee my soul hath found,
The peace, the joy I sought so long,
v2: I sighed for rest and happiness,
I yearned for them, not Thee;
But, while I passed my Savior by,
His love laid hold on me.
v3: I tried the broken cisterns, Lord,
E'en as I stooped to drink they fled,
And mocked me as I wailed.
v4: The pleasures lost I sadly mourned,
Till grace the sightless eyes received,
c1: Now none but Christ can satisfy,
There's love and life and lasting joy,
